column4: so nobody has any idea of how to even get a valid error message out of sshd ?
can anyone even read me ?
I see your text, yes
I'm connected via ssh now (from work)
thats, uh, nice for you. not really sure why you told me though :p
well when i log in I get a message from sshd, don't I..?
maybe, i dont know. do you ?
if you boot to the server installation, you can press CTRL+ALT+F1 and get a terminal
the regular download has the option to run a live desktop and not install
if you run:    /usr/lib/update-notifier/update-motd-updates-available     are you told?
thanks, i just read on https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SoftwareUpdates that i have to install that ;)
http://paste.ubuntu.com/1275049
no, ubuntu uses deb
no dep hell is when you need to scour the web to satisfy deps
then find that that too has deps you need to satisfy
well yeah, that will install the whole gnome desktop for you
/etc/update-motd.d   just like my pastebin shows
i dont understand what youre trying to say
its the location of the script.
yes, on your pc. do you suggest that i refence the file on your pc via ftp ? or email them to me ?
I already cat'd the files, so you have the contents....
isn't it the same as me sending you the file?
